items.name: Ext.tree.plugin.TreeViewDragDrop
allowContainerDrops
items.text: True if drops on the tree container (outside of a specific tree node) are allowed.

items.name: allowCopy
items.text: Set as `true` to allow the user to hold down the control key at the start of the drag operation and copy the dragged records between grids. Otherwise, dragged records will be moved. **Note:** This only applies to records dragged between two different grids with unique stores. See copy to enable the copying of all dragged records.

items.name: allowParentInserts
items.text:
Allow inserting a dragged node between an expanded parent node and its first child that will become a sibling of
the parent when dropped.

items.name: appendOnly
items.text: True if the tree should only allow append drops (use for trees which are sorted).

items.name: containerScroll
items.text: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations. A Ext.dd.ScrollManager configuration may also be passed.

items.name: copy
items.text: Set as `true` to copy the records from the source grid to the destination drop grid. Otherwise, dragged records will be moved. **Note:** This only applies to records dragged between two different grids with unique stores. See allowCopy to allow only control-drag operations to copy records.

items.name: ddGroup
items.text:
A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then both the DragZones and
DropZone used by this plugin will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.

items.name: displayField
items.text: The name of the model field that is used to display the text for the nodes

items.name: dragGroup
items.text: The ddGroup to which the property-dragZone will belong. This defines which other DropZones the DragZone will interact with. Drag/DropZones only interact with other Drag/DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup.

items.name: dragText
items.text: The text to show while dragging. Two placeholders can be used in the text: - `{0}` The number of selected items. - `{1}` 's' when more than 1 items (only useful for English). **NOTE:** The node's Ext.tree.Panel#cfg-displayField will be shown when a single node is dragged unless dragText is a simple text string.

items.name: dragZone
items.text: A config object to apply to the creation of the property-dragZone which handles for drag start gestures. Template methods of the DragZone may be overridden using this config.

items.name: dropGroup
items.text: The ddGroup to which the property-dropZone will belong. This defines which other DragZones the DropZone will interact with. Drag/DropZones only interact with other Drag/DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup.

items.name: dropZone
items.text: A config object to apply to the creation of the property-dropZone which handles mouseover and drop gestures. Template methods of the DropZone may be overridden using this config.

items.name: enableDrag
items.text: Set to `false` to disallow dragging items from the View.

items.name: enableDrop
items.text: Set to `false` to disallow the View from accepting drop gestures.

items.name: expandDelay
items.text:
The delay in milliseconds to wait before expanding a target tree node while dragging a droppable node over the
target.

items.name: nodeHighlightColor
items.text: The color to use when visually highlighting the dragged or dropped node (default value is light blue). The color must be a 6 digit hex value, without a preceding '#'. See also nodeHighlightOnDrop and nodeHighlightOnRepair.

items.name: nodeHighlightOnDrop
items.text: Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are successfully dropped on their target. Defaults to the value of `Ext.enableFx`. See also nodeHighlightColor and nodeHighlightOnRepair.

items.name: nodeHighlightOnRepair
items.text: Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are repaired from an unsuccessful drag/drop. Defaults to the value of `Ext.enableFx`. See also nodeHighlightColor and nodeHighlightOnDrop.

items.name: pluginId
sortOnDrop
items.text: Configure as `true` to sort the target node into the current tree sort order after the dropped node is added.

items.name: stateEvents
items.text: The configured list of stateEvents used to (optionally) participate in Owner Component's state management.

items.name: beforedrop
node
items.text: The Ext.tree.View node **if any** over which the cursor was positioned.

items.name: data
items.text: The data object gathered at mousedown time by the cooperating Ext.dd.DragZones Ext.dd.DragZone#getDragData method. It contains the following properties:

items.name: copy
items.text: The value of copy. Or `true` if allowCopy is true **and** the control key was pressed as the drag operation began.

items.name: view
items.text:
The source tree view from which the drag
originated

items.name: ddel
items.text: The drag proxy element which moves with the cursor

items.name: item
items.text:
The tree view node upon which the mousedown event
was registered

items.name: records
items.text:
An Array of Models representing the
selected data being dragged from the source tree view

items.name: overModel
items.text: The Model over which the drop gesture took place

items.name: dropPosition
items.text:
`"before"` or `"after"` depending on whether the
cursor is above or below the mid-line of the node.

items.name: dropHandlers
items.text:
This parameter allows the developer to control when the drop action takes place.
It is useful if any asynchronous processing needs to be completed before
performing the drop. This object has the following properties:

items.name: wait
items.text:
Indicates whether the drop should be deferred.
Set this property to true to defer the drop.

items.name: processDrop
items.text:
A function to be called to complete
the drop operation.

items.name: cancelDrop
items.text:
A function to be called to cancel the
drop operation.

items.name: drop
items.text: **This event is fired through the Ext.tree.View and its owning Ext.tree.Panel. You can add listeners to the tree or tree Ext.tree.Panel#viewConfig object** Fired when a drop operation has been completed and the data has been moved or copied.

items.name: node
items.text: The Ext.tree.View node **if any** over which the cursor was positioned.

items.name: data
items.text: The data object gathered at mousedown time by the cooperating Ext.dd.DragZones Ext.dd.DragZone#getDragData method. It contains the following properties:

items.name: copy
items.text: The value of copy. Or `true` if allowCopy is true **and** the control key was pressed as the drag operation began.

items.name: view
items.text:
The source tree view from which the drag
originated

items.name: ddel
items.text: The drag proxy element which moves with the cursor

items.name: item
items.text:
The tree view node upon which the mousedown event
was registered

items.name: records
items.text:
An Array of Models representing the
selected data being dragged from the source tree view

items.name: overModel
items.text:
The Model over which the drop gesture took
place.

items.name: dropPosition
items.text:
`"before"` or `"after"` depending on whether the
cursor is above or below the mid-line of the node.

items.name: applyState
items.text:
The applyState method is invoked by the client Component's State mixin after initComponent method has been run for the client.

The supplied implementation is empty. If plugin Subclasses are to (optionally) participate in the client Component's
state management, implementers should provide a suitable method to utilize it.

items.name: state
items.text: The current plugin state object to be applied.

items.name: allState
items.text: The current aggregate state of the Component and all plugins.

items.name: clonePlugin
items.text: Creates clone of the plugin.

items.name: overrideCfg
items.text: Additional config for the derived plugin.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Instantiates the plugin.

items.name: config
items.text: Configuration object.

items.name: destroy
items.text:
The destroy method is invoked by the owning Component at the time the Component is
being destroyed.

items.name: disable
items.text:
The base implementation just sets the plugin's `disabled` flag to `true`

Plugin subclasses which need more complex processing may implement an overriding implementation.

items.name: enable
items.text:
The base implementation just sets the plugin's `disabled` flag to `false`

Plugin subclasses which need more complex processing may implement an overriding implementation.

items.name: getCmp
items.text: Returns the component to which this plugin is attached.
Owner component.

items.name: getState
items.text: The getState method is invoked by the client Component's State mixin when one or more of the the specified stateEvents are raised. The supplied implementation is empty. If plugin Subclasses are to (optionally) participate in the client Component's state management, implementers should provide a suitable method which returns a state object.
state

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: init
items.text:
The init method is invoked after initComponent method has been run for the client Component.

The supplied implementation is empty. Subclasses should perform plugin initialization, and set up bidirectional
links between the plugin and its client Component in their own implementation of this method.

items.name: client
items.text: The client Component which owns this plugin.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: setCmp
items.text: Sets the component to which this plugin is attached.

items.name: cmp
items.text: Owner component.

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: constructor
dragZone
items.text: An Ext.view.DragZone which handles mousedown and dragging of records from the grid.

items.name: dropZone
items.text: An Ext.grid.ViewDropZone which handles mouseover and dropping records in any grid which shares the same dropGroup.

items.name: isPlugin
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Plugin, or subclass thereof.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.
